data.description: The thickness of the top layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top layers.
data.img_description: This image shows all parts affected by the top thickness setting.
data.hints:
- With the top thickness you can set the thickness of the solid printed top layers of the print. A higher value ensures all gaps on the top layers close completely. On the other hand, this can also increase the print time and the amount of filament used.
- Ensure that you have enough top layers in your model to prevent holes and pillowing.
